sed internal function, represents editing action executed

remarks.para: Sed edits text copies from stdin (standard input) or file and outputs the result to stdout (standard output).
When executing sed command from command line, the actual command must be put within single quots (' '). sed also allows to add double quots (" ").
If no file names are specified, sed accepts input from stdin, usually it is keyboard or redirection result.
For details please reference sed related documentation.

example.eg_note: Replaces each occurrence of "Glenn" in file file1.txt with "Harold", output the result in file2.txt . The search part 's/Glenn/Harold/g' is a regular expression.
